TextView.android:text: 1)The typical value of SCR for modern alternator is
View Answer
Answer : Option B \n Always the typical value of SCR for modern alternator is 0.5.
2)An SCR has half cycle surge current rating of 3000 A for 50 Hz supply. One cycle surge current will be
View Answer
Answer : Option C
3)․An SCR is considered to be a semi controlled device because

RadioButton.android:text: A)it can be turned OFF but not ON with a gate pulse.
B)it conducts only during one half cycle of an alternating current wave.
C) it can be turned ON but not OFF with a gate pulse.
D)it can be turned ON only during one half cycle of an AC.

TextView.android:text: View Answer

Answer : Option C 
 During positive half cycle SCR is in forward blocking mode. By applying gate pulse the 
 SCR can be turned ON during forward blocking mode. But SCR can not be turned OFF by 
 applying gate pulse. It automatically turns off when anode current is below the Holding 
 current. That is why it is called semi controlled rectifier.
4) A single phase one pulse controlled circuit has a resistance R and counter emf E load 400 \n sin(314 t) as the source voltage. For a load counter emf of 200 V, the range of firing angle control is
View Answer
Answer : Option A \n So, control range is θ to ( π- θ ) i.e. 30° to 150°.
5)A single phase full bridge inverter can operated in load commutation mode in case load consist of
View Answer
Answer : Option B \n In this case reading current will flow in circuit and it will became zero so thyristor will be load commutated.
6)A step up chopper has input voltage 110 V and output voltage 150 V. The value of duty cycle is
View Answer
Answer : Option B \n For step-up chopper, E0=Edc/(1-α), E0 = output voltage and Edc = output voltage,α = 1- \n (110/150) ⇒ 0.26 where α = duty cycle. recheck
7)Which statement is true for latching current ?

RadioButton.android:text: A)It is related to turn off process of the device.
B)It is related to conduction process of device.
C)It is related to turn on process of the device.

TextView.android:text: View Answer
Answer : Option C \n Latching current is the minimum required anode current to turn on SCR.
8)If holding current of a thyristor is 2 mA then latching current should be
View Answer
Answer : Option D \n Generally latching current is 2 or 3 times of holding current.
9)In reverse blocking mode of a thyristor

RadioButton.android:text: A)junction J2 is in reverse bias and J1, J3 is in forward bias.
B)junction J3 is in forward bias and J1, J2 in reverse bias.
C)junction J1, J3 is in reverse bias and J2 is in forward bias
D)junction J1 and J2 is in forward bias and J3 is in reverse bias.

TextView.android:text: View Answer
Answer : Option C \n In reverse blocking mode J1 and J2 is in reverse bias and J2 is in forward bias.
10)In forward blocking mode of a thyristor

RadioButton.android:text: A)junction J2 is in reverse bias and J1, J3 is in forward bias.
B)junction J3 is in forward bias and J1, J2 is in reverse bias.
C)Junction J1, J3 is in reverse bias and J2 is in forward bias.
D)Junction J1 and J2 is in forward bias and J3 is in reverse bias.

TextView.android:text: View Answer
Answer : Option A \n In forward blocking mode junction J2 acts in reverse bias whereas J1 and J3 act in forward bias.
11)Leakage current flows through the thyristor in

RadioButton.android:text: C)both forward and reverse blocking mode.

TextView.android:text: View Answer
Answer : Option C \n In forward blocking mode junction J2 and in reverse blocking mode junction J1 and J3 act as a capacitor hence leakage current present in both mode.
12)Which triggering is the most reliable?
View Answer
Answer : Option B \n Gate triggering process is the most reliable as junction temperature does not rise to high value in this process.
13) Light triggering mainly used in
View Answer
Answer : Option C \n Light triggering combined with gate triggering mainly used in HVDC as this combination is very powerful triggering process.
14)If a latching current for the circuit shown in figure is 2 mA. Obtain the value of minimum width of the property turn ON the SCR?
View Answer
Answer : Option D \n
15)SCR will be turned off when anode current is

RadioButton.android:text: A)latching current but greater than holding current and gate signal is 0.
C)latching current but greater than holding current and gate signal is present.

TextView.android:text: View Answer

Answer : Option B \n When anode current is in between holding current and latching current then SCR is off only if gate signal is absent. When anode current is below holding current then it is properly turned off.
16)After proper turn on of thyristor

RadioButton.android:text: C)gate signal should present but can be removed.

TextView.android:text: View Answer
Answer : Option B \n After proper turn on of thyristor gate signal must be removed to reduce the loss in gate circuit.
17)Gate circuit or triggering circuit of a thyristor is

RadioButton.android:text: D)may be low power or high power circuit.

TextView.android:text: View Answer
Answer : Option A \n Thyristor circuit is high power circuit. But its triggering circuit is low power circuit.
18) A thyristor will be triggered when Vg = 1.5 volt and Ig = 100 mA in the given figure. Calculate the value of R in ohm is
View Answer
Answer : Option C \n
19)For an SCR gate cathode characteristic is a straight line of 130. For triggered source volume of 15 V and allowable gate power dissipation of 0.5 W compute the gate source resistance?
View Answer
Answer : Option A \n

View Answer
Answer : Option D \n So, minimum width of pulse is 100 µs.
